item.title: CSS Grid: Powering Layouts Beyond Flexbox
item.description: CSS Grid: A Comprehensive Layout Tool CSS Grid is a two-dimensional layout system for the web, enabling developers to create complex designs easily. It offers precise control over layout arrangements, making it possible to handle both columns and rows simultaneously. CSS Grid vs. Flexbox: Key Differences While Flexbox is designed for one-dimensional layouts, focusing either on rows or columns, CSS Grid shines in two-dimensional scenarios. Grid allows for defining layouts in both dimensions at once, providing a level of flexibility and control that Flexbox cannot match for certain design requirements.
